result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M. Hoeper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Clark County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent on Ct 1, Ct 2 and Ct 3 in this case and with Ct 1 in case 14CF124

miscConds.notes: Fees, surcharges and costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
The defendant shall not have any violent or disorderly conduct with L.G.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random urine testing/PBTs as required by the agent or any law enforcement .
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant granted huber privileges with the provision that he is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.  Additionally, Defendant is to provide the Jail staff with proof that he has transportation to and from work.

Jail sentence on counts 1,2&3 are  to run concurrent to each other. The defendant is granted credit for 40 days served.
Concurrent with: Jail sentence on counts 1,2&3 are  to run concurrent to each other.
